text: The men's C-1 5000 metres competition at the 2018 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships in Montemor-o-Velho took place at the Centro de Alto Rendimento de Montemor-o-Velho. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| Sunday 26 August 2018 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| 15:40 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final |} All times are Western European Summer Time (UTC+1) ==Results== As a long-distance event, it was held as a direct final. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Canoeist !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Sebastian Brendel | align="left"| | 23:40.857 |- | | align="left"|Fernando Jorge | align="left"| | 23:46.646 |- | | align="left"|Kirill Shamshurin | align="left"| | 24:09.504 |- | 4 | align="left"|Mateusz Kamiński | align="left"| | 24:25.916 |- | 5 | align="left"|Carlo Tacchini | align="left"| | 24:31.263 |- | 6 | align="left"|Manuel Campos | align="left"| | 24:32.367 |- | 7 | align="left"|Thomas Simart | align="left"| | 25:02.871 |- | 8 | align="left"|Aivis Tints | align="left"| | 25:04.850 |- | 9 | align="left"|Rui Lacerda | align="left"| | 25:06.489 |- | 10 | align="left"|Ilya Palonski | align="left"| | 25:22.358 |- | 11 | align="left"|Joosep Karlson | align="left"| | 25:37.886 |- | 12 | align="left"|Mark Oldershaw | align="left"| | 25:51.003 |- | 13 | align="left"|Filip Dvořák | align="left"| | 26:08.611 |- | 14 | align="left"|Eduard Shemetylo | align="left"| | 26:12.116 |- | 15 | align="left"|Ian Ross | align="left"| | 26:29.481 |- | 16 | align="left"|Takayuki Kokaji | align="left"| | 26:30.929 |- | 17 | align="left"|Ghailene Khattali | align="left"| | 27:06.032 |- | – | align="left"|Oleg Tarnovschi | align="left"| | |- | – | align="left"|Tamás Kiss | align="left"| | |} ==References== ICF
title: 2018 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships – Men's C-1 5000 metres
